name: clawbrain
description: Personal AI Memory System - remembers conversations, learns preferences, provides personalized context, and securely stores encrypted secrets
author: ClawColab

hooks.name: clawbrain-startup
hooks.description: Refreshes brain memory on startup, saves session on /new

optional.name: BRAIN_AGENT_ID
optional.description: Unique identifier for this agent's memories

optional.name: BRAIN_ENCRYPTION_KEY
optional.description: Fernet encryption key for securing sensitive data (auto-generated if not set)

security.reason: Manages encryption keys and installs startup hooks
install_actions: Creates SQLite database in working directory (or uses PostgreSQL if configured)

network_access.postgres: Optional - only if BRAIN_POSTGRES_HOST is configured
network_access.redis: Optional - only if BRAIN_REDIS_HOST is configured

scanner_notes.environment_variables: All env vars declared in environment.optional section. In 'optional' not 'required' because ClawBrain works with zero configuration (SQLite + auto-generated key). See environment.optional for full list.
scanner_notes.install_mechanism: Install spec provided: pip (line 18) + setup command (line 19). Source: PyPI (https://pypi.org/project/clawbrain/) and GitHub (https://github.com/clawcolab/clawbrain). No shell scripts - CLI only.
scanner_notes.sudo_requirements: Core installation NEVER needs sudo. pip install + clawbrain setup run in user space. Systemd instructions in SKILL.md Configuration section are OPTIONAL alternatives for env var configuration. See SECURITY.md 'No Sudo Required (Core Installation)' section.
scanner_notes.credentials: Encryption key managed securely. CLI can display key (with warnings and confirmation) for backup purposes only. Key stored at ~/.config/clawbrain/.brain_key with 0600 permissions. See SECURITY.md Key Management section.
scanner_notes.source_verification: GitHub: https://github.com/clawcolab/clawbrain, PyPI: https://pypi.org/project/clawbrain/, License: MIT, All code open source and auditable
